paper_abstract: We introduce the notion of Universally Decodable Matrices of Genus g (UDMG), which for g = 0 reduces to the notion of Universally Decodable Matrices (UDM) introduced in H. Fix positive K,N,L. A UDMG is a set {M-i vertical bar 1 <= i <= L} of matrices of size K x N over a finite field such that the rows of any matrix of K g columns formed from the initial segments of the M, are linearly independent. We show that UDMG can be used to build approximately universal codes. We then provide a dictionary between UDMG and linear codes under the m-metric, which quickly provides constructions of UDMG and places bounds on the size of UDMG.
